Package org.zaproxy.zap.utils

Class ApiUtils

java.lang.Object
org.zaproxy.zap.utils.ApiUtils
public final class ApiUtils extends Object
Utils for manipulating API calls and parameters.

      public static int getIntParam(net.sf.json.JSONObject params, String paramName) throws ApiException

      Parameters:
      params - the params
      paramName - the param name
      Returns:
      the int param
      Throws:
      ApiException - the api exception

    • getBooleanParam

      Gets a boolean from the parameter with the given name.
      Parameters:
      params - the API parameters
      paramName - the name of the parameter
      Returns:
      the boolean value
      Throws:
      ApiException - if the parameter is missing (MISSING_PARAMETER) or not a boolean (ILLEGAL_PARAMETER).
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • getOptionalEnumParam

      public static <E extends Enum<E>> E getOptionalEnumParam(net.sf.json.JSONObject params, String paramName, Class<E> enumType) throws ApiException
      Gets an optional enum param, returning null if the parameter was not found.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of the enum that will be returned
      Parameters:
      params - the params
      paramName - the param name
      enumType - the type of the enum
      Returns:
      the enum, or null
      Throws:
      ApiException - if the param value does not match any of the possible enum values

    • getContextByParamId

      public static Context getContextByParamId(net.sf.json.JSONObject params, String contextIdParamName) throws ApiException
      Gets the Context whose id is provided as a parameter with the given name. Throws an exception accordingly if not found or valid.
      Parameters:
      params - the params
      contextIdParamName - the context id param name
      Returns:
      the context
      Throws:
      ApiException - the api exception

    • getContextByName

      public static Context getContextByName(net.sf.json.JSONObject parameters, String parameterName) throws ApiException
      Returns the Context with the given name. The context's name is obtained from the given parameters, whose name is the value of parameterName.

      The parameter must exist, that is, it should be a mandatory parameter, otherwise a runtime exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      parameters - the parameters that contain the context's name
      parameterName - the name of the parameter used to obtain the context's name
      Returns:
      the Context with the given name
      Throws:
      ApiException - If the context with the given name does not exist
      Since:
      2.4.3
      See Also:
      • getContextByName(String)
      • JSONObject.getString(String)

    • getContextByName

      public static Context getContextByName(String contextName) throws ApiException
      Returns the Context with the given name.
      Parameters:
      contextName - the name of the context
      Returns:
      the Context with the given name
      Throws:
      ApiException - If the context with the given name does not exist
      Since:
      2.4.3
      See Also:
      • getContextByName(JSONObject, String)

    • getAuthority

      public static String getAuthority(String site)
      Returns the authority of the given site (i.e. host ":" port ).

      For example, the result of returning the authority from: 

      http://example.com:8080/some/path?a=b#c
      is: 
      example.com:8080

      If the provided site does not have a port, it's added the default of the used scheme.

      Note: The implementation is optimised to handle only HTTP and HTTPS schemes, the behaviour is undefined for other schemes.

      Parameters:
      site - the site whose authority will be extracted
      Returns:
      the authority of the site
      Since:
      2.5.0
